dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...could crack anything, like, from Apple, right? Even the latest models.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...could crack anything, like, from Apple, right? Even the latest models.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Uncloaked by Forbes in March, Atlanta-based Grayshift promised governments its GrayKey tech could crack the passcodes of the latest iOS models, right up to the iPhone X.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god, yes! The iPhone X, too! They were just, um, unstoppable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my god, yes! The iPhone X, too! They were just, um, unstoppable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grayshift promised governments its GrayKey tech could crack the passcodes of the latest iOS models, right up to the iPhone X.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Apple was just, like, pouring money into security, right? Project Fortress!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Apple was just, like, pouring money into security, right? Project Fortress!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From then on, Apple continued to invest in security in earnest, continually putting up barriers for Grayshift to jump over.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Project Fortress, yes, exactly! With, uh, ex-NSA engineers, so you know it was serious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Project Fortress, yes, exactly! With, uh, ex-N S A engineers, so you know it was serious.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But now? Boom! iOS 12 and up? GrayKey is, like, toast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But now? Boom! iOS twelve and up? GrayKey is, like, toast.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Multiple sources familiar with the GrayKey tech tell Forbes the device can no longer break the passcodes of any iPhone running iOS 12 or above.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally toast! Partial extraction only, like, just unencrypted files and metadata. No passcodes!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally toast! Partial extraction only, like, just unencrypted files and metadata. No passcodes!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On those devices, GrayKey can only do whats called a partial extraction, sources from the forensic community said. That means police using the tool can only draw out unencrypted files and some metadata, such as file sizes and folder structures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And Grayshift? Financial losses. Layoffs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And Grayshift? Financial losses. Layoffs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's wild. And Apple's, like, aggressively lobbying governments about privacy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's wild. And Apple's, like, aggressively lobbying governments about privacy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, Apple chief Tim Cook visited Europe this week, talking up the need for all tech companies to improve privacy for users.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Lobbying, yes! And the reason Grayshift is struggling? A fundamental flaw.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Lobbying, yes! And the reason Grayshift is struggling? A fundamental flaw.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A mystery fix Though its clear Apple has locked GrayShift out, no one actually knows just how the iPhone maker has done it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A legacy algorithm! From, uh, a now-bankrupt European firm, which is just... wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A legacy algorithm! From, uh, a now-bankrupt European firm, which is just... wow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! So they can't even fix it easily. But the police chief, he's like, "they'll find a workaround."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! So they can't even fix it easily. But the police chief, he's like, they'll find a workaround.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Police officer Captain John Sherwin of the Rochester Police Department in Minnesota said of the claim iOS 12 was preventing GrayKey from unlocking iPhones: Thats a fairly accurate assessment as to what we have experienced. Give it time and I am sure a workaround will be developed ... and then the cycle will repeat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the cycle, right? But even the forensic experts are, like, totally stumped!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the cycle, right? But even the forensic experts are, like, totally stumped!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A mystery fix Though its clear Apple has locked GrayShift out, no one actually knows just how the iPhone maker has done it. Vladimir Katalov, chief of forensic tech provider Elcomsoft, has repeatedly uncovered weaknesses in Apple technology. But he was stumped too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Vladimir Katalov! He has no idea how Apple did it, um, could be kernel protection.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Vladimir Katalov! He has no idea how Apple did it, um, could be kernel protection.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vladimir Katalov, chief of forensic tech provider Elcomsoft... was stumped too. No idea. It could be everything from better kernel protection to stronger configuration-profile installation restrictions, he suggested.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Could be anything! But, like, Grayshift just went global. UK police were using them!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Could be anything! But, like, Grayshift just went global. U K police were using them!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its just gone global. Wiredrevealed last week that a number of U.K. police agencies are now using GrayKeys.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Tim Cook's, uh, over there in Europe, talking about privacy, GDPR...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Tim Cook's, uh, over there in Europe, talking about privacy, G D P R...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, Apple chief Tim Cook visited Europe this week, talking up the need for all tech companies to improve privacy for users.

dialogue_turns.text: Coincidence? I think not! So much happening all at once.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Coincidence? I think not! So much happening all at once.

dialogue_turns.text: Right? The timing is just... incredible.
